reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 6 night stay at Le Mas Des Carassins Hotel. The room and bathroom was well appointed (a touch tight as you expect in France). Our room opened up to a closed off patio that we had wine and apps every evening before dinner. The hotel is minutes from town and a great base to explore Provence. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful every morning and the staff was very friendly, accomodating and helpful. We really love St Remy and Le Mas Des Carassins Hotel really made the trip!
reviews.title: Wonderful charm in quintessential Provence!

reviews.text: This is a beautiful small hotel on lovely grounds. It is an excellent base for exploring Arles, Avignon, La Camargue, and Les Baux. They serve superb dinners every night except Friday and Saturday. And the French bulldog Zazou is delightful--especially for those of us who left our dogs at home and crave a little canine companionship.
reviews.title: Beautiful small hotel
Thanks for the Relaxing Stay
reviews.text: My husband and I loved this hotel. We had been in London, Paris, and then Arles and had been busy, busy, busy. Here, we relaxed.

We got to Les Mas Des Carassins and loved everything: the staff, Zhou-Zhou the bulldog, the olive trees, the pool, the FOOD ( not breakfast so much, it is standard French continental)- but the suppers were lovely. I second the person who said they were better than many of the restaurants in St Remy. We ate there twice out of four nights and were very happy.
reviews.title: Worst hotel experience ever!!

reviews.text: We also loved the cigalles, the swallows, and the friendly staff.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel and the Wonderful Dinners
Want to go back
reviews.text: We spent two days at Mas Des Carassins on our recent trip to France. We loved it, the rooms were bright, spacious and very clean. The hotel is in a beautiful park-like setting with a pool, garden, seating area and fish pond. However we are big foodies and the highlight for us was the food, if you are going make sure you sign up for the half-board. For an extra 22 Euros you get an amazing five course meal. Breakfast is mandatory is high season, but optional in low.

Book this place, and you will not regret it. I spent two extra nights in Arles that I wish I could have back to stay here instead. The rooms are large and sunny, St. Remy is very close and easy. We arrived by TGV to Avignon and the ride is easy. There is no pressure to eat dinner with the hotel, but you should. This is the part of France where you slow down the tourist agenda and simply enjoy being there. If you must fill your days with touring, there is plenty, just don't forget to slow down to enjoy it. Next time, I'm staying for a week. Remember to pet Beau and Zuzu, they are very cute.
reviews.title: Can't Wait To Return

reviews.text: My husband and I selected Le Mas des Carassins based on Trip Advisor reviews, and we have just returned from ten nights there. It was everything we hoped for. We had a smaller room on the ground floor, but enough space for our several pieces of luggage. The bathroom was large and modern. Our room had a small courtyard with patio table and chairs, which we enjoyed in the evenings. We had several meals at the hotel during our stay and the food was excellent and reasonably priced. The staff are very knowledgeable about the area and extremely helpful. It was a perfect base for day trips. We would return, and highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Everything We Hoped For

reviews.text: Arrived late on a Thursday night, just in time for dinner and a relaxed evening in a beautiful hotel. Too bad dinner is not available Fri-Sunday, but the town has many good places and owners very helpful in making reservations. St. Remy good Bouche du Rhone touring hq. Just sorry we did not plan to spend more time in town's own Galo-Roman musee and nearby Glanum ruins. Also wished we had planned hike/bike. But wonderful place to drive to Avignon and Arles, Les Baux, etc. Very helpful owners overall. Minor complaints: no internet access in rooms, or reliable public computer -- maybe you shouldn't try to stay connected in such a beautiful place anyway. And breakfast, while good, would profit from fresh juice and fruit in this farm belt of France.
reviews.title: Great place, great location
Far exceeded even our lofty expectations
reviews.text: There is nothing this hotel managment won't do to help their guests have a good stay. We were amazed when management even drove us to Avignon to help secure a rental car when there were no cars in St Remy! The caring attitude and follow through in all aspects of service completely amazed us. The hotel has beautiful grounds, wonderful food and comfortable rooms as well.

reviews.title: a highlight of our trip
reviews.text: Le Mas des Carassins is a very special place. The accomodations were great, and the grounds were just lovely. The breakfast was more than adequate, but most of all - the staff was friendly and more than anxious to make our stay in Provence comfortable. I would definitely go back.

reviews.title: Wonderful grounds, delightful staff and dogs, good accomodations
reviews.text: My wife and I spent four delightful days and nights at Le Mas des Carassins. Located about a kilometer from the town center, this bed and breakfast provides quiet evenings and the most beautiful grounds, all within a most comfortable walk from town.

reviews.title: a gem
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice. Large enough. Tastefully decorated. Clean and comfortable.

reviews.title: Just loved the whole experience of staying in Le Mas des Carassins
reviews.text: Breakfast is excellent. You can take dinner there a couple nights out of the week; fixed menu, reasonable price. We ate there one night and it was a very good meal.

We just spent 10 days in Provence and found the Mas to be everything that other travelers rated it to be. We went with a deluxe room and found it to be comfortable, clean and attractive. Suggestions for local dining were appreciated and they helped make the reservations.The grounds were well taken care of and the dining terrace both serene and comfortable for breakfast and dinner alike.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations

reviews.text: Highly recommended for the laid back atmosphere of Provence.
reviews.title: Is this one starting to slip?

reviews.text: We stayed at the Mas for six days in May. While the location, facilities, grounds are as described by other clients, we did have some reservations that perhaps this hotel may be starting to slip.
reviews.title: Le Mas des Carassins--one of the best!
Will return to Le Mas des Carassins
reviews.text: The walls of our room were in need of a coat of paint and we would have thought this would have been done in the off season. The gardens were in need of tending but perhaps this could be excused due to the time of year. The soap dish was pulled out of the wall and not repaired.

Though we were welcomed enthusiastically upon arrival, the gentlemen who tend the desk and their dogs were conspicuous in their absence for most of the week. When we questionned their whereabouts we were told they were at the other hotel. Have they expanded and now are spread too thinly?
reviews.title: Loved the Mas Des Carassins
